intro: Cryptanthemis slateri, commonly known as the slender cryptanthemis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically oval and have a slightly hairy texture. Cryptanthemis slateri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
